title: What does it mean on the BK 13 NOTICE OF CHAPTER. 13 BANKRUPTCY CASE "trade name" in the 3rd box on the left?
question: Is a trade name a dba and the fictitous business name or another name you id yourself online and in your business cards?
answers: Its a name used for a business. Also for women who married within the last 8 years, I always ask if they have used their former name so that we identify all names used within the prior 8 years.

This could be the name of any business the debtor used with making or cosigning debt. The best practice is to over include such names rather than inadvertently miss a name. Hope this perspective helps!

It could refer to any licensed name (such as a maiden name, company name with a federal or municipal registration). I doubt your online name would be included there, but it's designed to assist matching up the case with the party receiving the notice.
The purpose behind this is to assist all creditors in identifying any debt owed by you to the creditor. The creditor may have the debt identified by your trade name instead of by your name.
Short and succinct answer: "Yes". That is exactly what it is there for.
